name: ListAutomationActions
description:
Retrieve all automation actions with optional query filters.

Use this tool to list all available automation actions from PagerDuty, filtered by any specified query parameters. Results are sorted alphabetically by action name and can be paginated.

parameters.name: api_version_header
parameters.description: Specifies the API version for response formatting. Use predefined version strings.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specifies the format of the data being sent to the server. Use 'application/json'.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return, limited by the API's maximum request size.

value_schema.description: The minimum of the `limit` parameter used in the request or the maximum request size of the API.

parameters.name: next_page_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor to request the next set of results, typically obtained from the previous response.

value_schema.description: Optional parameter used to request the "next" set of results from an API.  The value provided here is most commonly obtained from the `next_cursor` field of the previous request.  When no value is provided, the request starts at the beginning of the result set.

parameters.name: filter_by_name
parameters.description: Filters results to include actions matching the specified name using case insensitive substring matching.

value_schema.description: Filters results to include the ones matching the name (case insensitive substring matching)

parameters.name: filter_by_runner_id
parameters.description: Filter results to include actions linked to a specific runner. Use 'any' to include only those linked to any runner, excluding unlinked actions.

value_schema.description:
Filters results to include the ones linked to the specified runner.
Specifying the value `any` filters results to include the ones linked to runners only,
thus omitting the results not linked to runners.

parameters.name: classification_filter
parameters.description: Filters results to include only those matching the specified classification, such as 'diagnostic' or 'remediation'.

value_schema.description: Filters results to include the ones matching the specified classification (aka category)

parameters.name: filter_by_team_id
parameters.description: Filters results to include actions associated with a specified team by providing its ID.

value_schema.description: Filters results to include the ones associated with the specified team.

parameters.name: filter_by_service_id
parameters.description: Filters results to include only those actions associated with the specified service ID.

value_schema.description: Filters results to include the ones associated with the specified service

parameters.name: filter_by_action_type
parameters.description: Filter results to include only those matching the specified action type. Accepts 'script' or 'process_automation'.

value_schema.description: Filters results to include the ones matching the specified action type

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The minimum of the `limit` parameter used in the request or the maximum request size of the API.

value_schema.description: The minimum of the `limit` parameter used in the request or the maximum request size of the API.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Optional parameter used to request the "next" set of results from an API.  The value provided here is most commonly obtained from the `next_cursor` field of the previous request.  When no value is provided, the request starts at the beginning of the result set.

value_schema.description: Optional parameter used to request the "next" set of results from an API.  The value provided here is most commonly obtained from the `next_cursor` field of the previous request.  When no value is provided, the request starts at the beginning of the result set.

value_schema.description: Filters results to include the ones matching the name (case insensitive substring matching)

parameters.description:
Filters results to include the ones linked to the specified runner.
Specifying the value `any` filters results to include the ones linked to runners only,
thus omitting the results not linked to runners.

value_schema.description:
Filters results to include the ones linked to the specified runner.
Specifying the value `any` filters results to include the ones linked to runners only,
thus omitting the results not linked to runners.

parameters.description: Filters results to include the ones matching the specified classification (aka category)

value_schema.description: Filters results to include the ones matching the specified classification (aka category)
